p: The majority of the studies were exclusively conducted on dengue [ 15– 112] (n = 123), with 16.% exclusively conducted on chikungunya (n = 29) [ 113– 136] and 12% conducted on both dengue and chikungunya (n = 23) [ 137– 154]; furthermore, seven studies were conducted on Zika [ 8, 155– 160], one study was conducted on both dengue and Zika [ 161] and two studies were conducted on both viruses [ 162].
